text: VII They had a very fine day for Box Hill ; and all the other outward circumstances of arrangement , accommodation , and punctuality , were in favour of a pleasant party . Mr. Weston directed the whole , officiating safely between Hartfield and the Vicarage , and every body was in good time .
text_tokenized: VII They had a very fine day for Box Hill ; and all the other outward circumstances of arrangement , accommodation , and punctuality , were in favour of a pleasant party . Mr. Weston directed the whole , officiating safely between Hartfield and the Vicarage , and every body was in good time .

text: Emma and Harriet went together ; Miss Bates and her niece , with the Eltons ; the gentlemen on horseback .

text: Mr. and Mrs. Elton , indeed , shewed no unwillingness to mix , and be as agreeable as they could ; but during the two whole hours that were spent on the hill , there seemed a principle of separation , between the other parties , too strong for any fine prospects , or any cold collation , or any cheerful Mr. Weston , to remove .

text: There she is -- no , that 's somebody else .
text_tokenized: There she is -- no , that 's somebody else .

text: That 's one of the ladies in the Irish car party , not at all like her.-- Well , I declare-- " They walked off , followed in half a minute by Mr. Knightley .
text_tokenized: That 's one of the ladies in the Irish car party , not at all like her.-- Well , I declare-- " They walked off , followed in half a minute by Mr. Knightley .

text: Mr. Weston , his son , Emma , and Harriet , only remained ; and the young man 's spirits now rose to a pitch almost unpleasant .
text_tokenized: Mr. Weston , his son , Emma , and Harriet , only remained ; and the young man 's spirits now rose to a pitch almost unpleasant .

text: Even Emma grew tired at last of flattery and merriment , and wished herself rather walking quietly about with any of the others , or sitting almost alone , and quite unattended to , in tranquil observation of the beautiful views beneath her . The appearance of the servants looking out for them to give notice of the carriages was a joyful sight ; and even the bustle of collecting and preparing to depart , and the solicitude of Mrs. Elton to have _ her _ carriage first , were gladly endured , in the prospect of the quiet drive home which was to close the very questionable enjoyments of this day of pleasure .
text_tokenized: Even Emma grew tired at last of flattery and merriment , and wished herself rather walking quietly about with any of the others , or sitting almost alone , and quite unattended to , in tranquil observation of the beautiful views beneath her . The appearance of the servants looking out for them to give notice of the carriages was a joyful sight ; and even the bustle of collecting and preparing to depart , and the solicitude of Mrs. Elton to have _ her _ carriage first , were gladly endured , in the prospect of the quiet drive home which was to close the very questionable enjoyments of this day of pleasure .

text: Such another scheme , composed of so many ill - assorted people , she hoped never to be betrayed into again .
text_tokenized: Such another scheme , composed of so many ill - assorted people , she hoped never to be betrayed into again .

text: While waiting for the carriage , she found Mr. Knightley by her side .
text_tokenized: While waiting for the carriage , she found Mr. Knightley by her side .

text: He looked around , as if to see that no one were near , and then said , " Emma , I must once more speak to you as I have been used to do : a privilege rather endured than allowed , perhaps , but I must still use it . I can not see you acting wrong , without a remonstrance .
text_tokenized: He looked around , as if to see that no one were near , and then said , " Emma , I must once more speak to you as I have been used to do : a privilege rather endured than allowed , perhaps , but I must still use it . I can not see you acting wrong , without a remonstrance .

text: How could you be so unfeeling to Miss Bates ?
text_tokenized: How could you be so unfeeling to Miss Bates ?

text: How could you be so insolent in your wit to a woman of her character , age , and situation?-- Emma , I had not thought it possible . " Emma recollected , blushed , was sorry , but tried to laugh it off .
text_tokenized: How could you be so insolent in your wit to a woman of her character , age , and situation?-- Emma , I had not thought it possible . " Emma recollected , blushed , was sorry , but tried to laugh it off .

text: " Nay , how could I help saying what I did?--Nobody could have helped it .
text_tokenized: " Nay , how could I help saying what I did?--Nobody could have helped it .

text: It was not so very bad .
text_tokenized: It was not so very bad .

text: I dare say she did not understand me . " " I assure you she did .
text_tokenized: I dare say she did not understand me . " " I assure you she did .

text: She felt your full meaning .
text_tokenized: She felt your full meaning .

text: She has talked of it since .
text_tokenized: She has talked of it since .

text: I wish you could have heard how she talked of it-- with what candour and generosity .
text_tokenized: I wish you could have heard how she talked of it-- with what candour and generosity .

text: I wish you could have heard her honouring your forbearance , in being able to pay her such attentions , as she was for ever receiving from yourself and your father , when her society must be so irksome .
text_tokenized: I wish you could have heard her honouring your forbearance , in being able to pay her such attentions , as she was for ever receiving from yourself and your father , when her society must be so irksome .

text: " Oh ! " cried Emma , " I know there is not a better creature in the world : but you must allow , that what is good and what is ridiculous are most unfortunately blended in her .
text_tokenized: " Oh ! " cried Emma , " I know there is not a better creature in the world : but you must allow , that what is good and what is ridiculous are most unfortunately blended in her .

text: " They are blended , " said he , " I acknowledge ; and , were she prosperous , I could allow much for the occasional prevalence of the ridiculous over the good .
text_tokenized: " They are blended , " said he , " I acknowledge ; and , were she prosperous , I could allow much for the occasional prevalence of the ridiculous over the good .

text: Were she a woman of fortune , I would leave every harmless absurdity to take its chance , I would not quarrel with you for any liberties of manner .
text_tokenized: Were she a woman of fortune , I would leave every harmless absurdity to take its chance , I would not quarrel with you for any liberties of manner .

text: Were she your equal in situation-- but , Emma , consider how far this is from being the case . She is poor ; she has sunk from the comforts she was born to ; and , if she live to old age , must probably sink more .
text_tokenized: Were she your equal in situation-- but , Emma , consider how far this is from being the case . She is poor ; she has sunk from the comforts she was born to ; and , if she live to old age , must probably sink more .

text: Her situation should secure your compassion .
text_tokenized: Her situation should secure your compassion .

text: It was badly done , indeed !
text_tokenized: It was badly done , indeed !

text: You , whom she had known from an infant , whom she had seen grow up from a period when her notice was an honour , to have you now , in thoughtless spirits , and the pride of the moment , laugh at her , humble her -- and before her niece , too -- and before others , many of whom ( certainly _ some _ , ) would be entirely guided by _ your _ treatment of her.--This is not pleasant to you , Emma -- and it is very far from pleasant to me ; but I must , I will,--I will tell you truths while I can ; satisfied with proving myself your friend by very faithful counsel , and trusting that you will some time or other do me greater justice than you can do now . "
text_tokenized: You , whom she had known from an infant , whom she had seen grow up from a period when her notice was an honour , to have you now , in thoughtless spirits , and the pride of the moment , laugh at her , humble her -- and before her niece , too -- and before others , many of whom ( certainly _ some _ , ) would be entirely guided by _ your _ treatment of her.--This is not pleasant to you , Emma -- and it is very far from pleasant to me ; but I must , I will,--I will tell you truths while I can ; satisfied with proving myself your friend by very faithful counsel , and trusting that you will some time or other do me greater justice than you can do now . "

text: While they talked , they were advancing towards the carriage ; it was ready ; and , before she could speak again , he had handed her in .
text_tokenized: While they talked , they were advancing towards the carriage ; it was ready ; and , before she could speak again , he had handed her in .

text: He had misinterpreted the feelings which had kept her face averted , and her tongue motionless .
text_tokenized: He had misinterpreted the feelings which had kept her face averted , and her tongue motionless .

text: They were combined only of anger against herself , mortification , and deep concern .
text_tokenized: They were combined only of anger against herself , mortification , and deep concern .

text: She had not been able to speak ; and , on entering the carriage , sunk back for a moment overcome -- then reproaching herself for having taken no leave , making no acknowledgment , parting in apparent sullenness , she looked out with voice and hand eager to shew a difference ; but it was just too late .
text_tokenized: She had not been able to speak ; and , on entering the carriage , sunk back for a moment overcome -- then reproaching herself for having taken no leave , making no acknowledgment , parting in apparent sullenness , she looked out with voice and hand eager to shew a difference ; but it was just too late .

text: He had turned away , and the horses were in motion .
text_tokenized: He had turned away , and the horses were in motion .

text: She continued to look back , but in vain ; and soon , with what appeared unusual speed , they were half way down the hill , and every thing left far behind .
text_tokenized: She continued to look back , but in vain ; and soon , with what appeared unusual speed , they were half way down the hill , and every thing left far behind .

text: She was vexed beyond what could have been expressed -- almost beyond what she could conceal .
text_tokenized: She was vexed beyond what could have been expressed -- almost beyond what she could conceal .

text: Never had she felt so agitated , mortified , grieved , at any circumstance in her life .
text_tokenized: Never had she felt so agitated , mortified , grieved , at any circumstance in her life .

text: She was most forcibly struck .
text_tokenized: She was most forcibly struck .

text: The truth of this representation there was no denying .
text_tokenized: The truth of this representation there was no denying .

text: She felt it at her heart .
text_tokenized: She felt it at her heart .

text: How could she have been so brutal , so cruel to Miss Bates !
text_tokenized: How could she have been so brutal , so cruel to Miss Bates !

text: How could she have exposed herself to such ill opinion in any one she valued ! And how suffer him to leave her without saying one word of gratitude , of concurrence , of common kindness ! Time did not compose her .
text_tokenized: How could she have exposed herself to such ill opinion in any one she valued ! And how suffer him to leave her without saying one word of gratitude , of concurrence , of common kindness ! Time did not compose her .

text: As she reflected more , she seemed but to feel it more .
text_tokenized: As she reflected more , she seemed but to feel it more .

text: She never had been so depressed .
text_tokenized: She never had been so depressed .

text: Happily it was not necessary to speak .
text_tokenized: Happily it was not necessary to speak .

text: There was only Harriet , who seemed not in spirits herself , fagged , and very willing to be silent ; and Emma felt the tears running down her cheeks almost all the way home , without being at any trouble to check them , extraordinary as they were .
text_tokenized: There was only Harriet , who seemed not in spirits herself , fagged , and very willing to be silent ; and Emma felt the tears running down her cheeks almost all the way home , without being at any trouble to check them , extraordinary as they were .
